column5: Actually I don't think about life jackets very often.Stubborn I guess.When I have put it on I had very good reasons.Ive come across Lac Suel a few times coming back from Broad Lake and pretty much idled home climbing up and down the waves griping my throttle handle pretty hard.Couple years ago in 80+ km winds on Eagle heading back to North Shore Lodge.There have been days I put it on.

Regarding "very good reasons" for putting on a life jacket - they might not be so obvious. I forget the exact statistics, but a shocking percentage of mid-aged and older male drowning victims in Wisconsin, when the bodies are recovered, have their flies down. Can't be too careful, I guess.....
Pee buckets come in handy also,instead of trying to Lean over the edge.

That's what I like about my Lund.Very wide gun whales.Iam still pretty good at doing the balancing act on them.So far have never gone in.Also have a pvc piece of eavestrough with end end cap and a tape down fish measuring tape which does double duty,about 40 " long.
Might not be long enough,if you ever guide Big tap root!
I believe I viewed the video some time ago, you can never tell what's gonna happen out on the water! Bill

Had some guys out on Cedar last year for some walleye and the guys in the follow boat hooked into a muskie.Great fight on a walleye rod and funny toward end with a to small of a net.https://youtube.com/watch?v=Yk0p-xvgMj0&feature=shares
The guide put them in the right spot,I assume they were trying for walleye,if that was a rubber net it probably got destroyed.

Quote: Originally Posted by EckohltQuote: Originally Posted by prov1800Had some guys out on Cedar last year for some walleye and the guys in the follow boat hooked into a muskie.Great fight on a walleye rod and funny toward end with a to small of a net.https://youtube.com/watch?v=Yk0p-xvgMj0&feature=sharesThe guide put them in the right spot,I assume they were trying for walleye,if that was a rubber net it probably got destroyed.Walleye spot with plenty of action calls in big pike and muskies.Net part hung in but handle bent.Guy won't forget that fish.
Put us on a couple of those next September when we come up there to fish with you please!
Try my best.Still have to hook them.lol.
That lake is loaded with musky. I went last July for the first time and we caught 9 musky's in two days, with the biggest being 44".
There probably be enough hardware flying in the air for skies on cedar next year,they'll see it on the space satellites,the word is out!
John, I bet you were thinking “I hope he has a life jacket on.”
I'm sure captain Ahab wished he had a life jacket on,when he hooked Moby.
